author: S Prasad
text:
Lieutenant Governor A.K. Singh on Tuesday expressed satisfaction over the maintenance of Law and Order situation in the Union Territory and said that it was under control due to sustained action.

In his Republic Day address circulated to the media in his absence, Mr. Singh said, “The overall crime rate had declined by 14 per cent during the current year as compared to corresponding period last year. Puducherry has the second best conviction rate and is at fourth place in detection rate of crimes in the country.”

Referring to the havoc caused by the recent incessant rains, he said that the government seized of the immediate need of the rain affected and sanctioned relief of Rs. 4,000 to all ration cardholders in the Union Territory. An amount of Rs.22.09 crore has been sanctioned as relief assistance to the farmers for damages caused by heavy rains.

The Central teams made an assessment of damages and the government has sought Rs.494 crore as relief. The Centre has announced interim relief of Rs.50 crore and the government has requested for an early release of the relief funds, he said.

Mr. Singh said that a substantial part of the plan outlay of Rs. 2,700 crore approved by the NITI Aayog for the fiscal 2015-16 has been utilised. Puducherry has to its credit sanctioning the maximum amount of old age pension and widow pension, he said.

Irrigation projects

The government’s top priority is safeguarding water bodies and the Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayee Yojana (PMKSY) will be implemented in a comprehensive manner to develop water resources in the Union Territory with 100 per cent central assistance.
title: Law & order satisfactory: Lt. Governor
